page.title: 19TRANSPORT ANALYSIS,HOCKLIFFE
page.content: When we visited{Hockliffe}to survey the amenities we were very aware of the huge amount of traffic passing through the village. We returned on {5th.July, 1985}and carried out a {traffic survey}at the crossroads in Hockliffe where the{A5}meets the{A4012 and the{B528.}For results see{A5 {TRAFFIC CENSUS,HOCKLIFFE We expected to find that most of the traffic was moving along the A5 and passing through Hockliffe but we soon discovered that a large amount of traffic was actually joining or leaving the A5 at this point, mainly to or from{Leighton Buzzard. Most of the traffic joining the A5 from Leighton Buzzard went in a southerly direction towards{Dunstable. { A lot of amenities in Hockliffe seem {to exist to service this traffic.
